hackathon-description-text: The Cracking the Code Hackathon will:

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of education for the Tow-Knight Center for Entrepreneurial Journalism at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism
Spokesperson and Media/Marketing Manager at Google
Julian Moncada is an analyst at Lerer Hippeau Ventures
Communication Specialist and Expert on Media, Gender and Communication for Development at the Ford Foundation

hackathon-rules:
- Coding: Teams may use existing tools and libraries but all of their project’s code must be new. All of the project’s code must be written during the event
- Submissions: Each team must submit its project by 5 pm on Friday, January 30th 
- Copyright: Participants to the hackathon own the copyright to their code. Still, it is wonderful to share your code and data and we would love it if you open-source it. Each participant is solely responsible for any unauthorized use of third party intellectual property.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A panel of judges will select three winning prototypes awarding teams cash prizes to develop innovative apps tackling the obstacles women face in the digital news startup industry

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Potential to help women digital news entrepreneurs achieve startup success
New ideas and creative design aimed at maximizing impact
Reflects high level of technical skill

hackathon-location-address: 1 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA
hackathon-description-header: Come help us close the digital news gender gap and compete for $10,000 in Google prize money.
